pages.title: Color the Rabbit
pages.instruction: Use your crayons to color me in!
pages.subject: rabbit

pages.instruction: Use your crayons to color me in!
pages.subject: acorn

pages.title: Color the Mushroom
pages.instruction: Use your crayons to color this friendly mushroom!

pages.title: Color the Owl
pages.instruction: Use your crayons to color the sleepy owl!
pages.subject: owl

pages.title: Color the Raccoon
pages.instruction: Use your crayons to color the silly raccoon!
pages.subject: raccoon

pages.title: Color the Squirrel
pages.instruction: Use your crayons to color me in!
pages.subject: squirrel

pages.title: Color the Deer
pages.instruction: Use your crayons to color the friendly deer!
pages.subject: deer

pages.title: Color the Pine Tree
pages.instruction: Use your crayons to color the tall pine tree green!
pages.subject: pine tree

pages.title: Trace the Letter C with Cute Squirrel
pages.instruction: Trace over the dotted letter C and say 'C is for cute squirrel friend!'

pages.title: Trace the Number 5 with Forest Friends
pages.instruction: Trace over the dotted number 5 to help the forest friends count their acorns!

pages.title: Trace the Letter A with Ant
pages.instruction: Trace over the dotted letter A like a friendly forest ant!

pages.title: Trace the Sparkly Star ★
pages.instruction: Trace over the dotted star lines with your pencil!

pages.title: Trace the Number 2 with Forest Friends
pages.instruction: Trace over the dotted number 2 and count two friendly forest animals!

pages.title: Trace the Letter K with Kangaroo
pages.instruction: Trace over the dotted letter K like a hopping kangaroo friend!

pages.title: Connect the Dots
pages.instruction: Connect the dots from 1 to 12 to make a pretty flower!

pages.title: Connect the Dots
pages.instruction: Connect the dots from 1 to 12 to make a cozy forest cabin square!

pages.title: Connect the Dots
pages.instruction: Connect the dots from 1 to 12 to make a triangle pine tree!

pages.title: Connect the Dots
pages.instruction: Connect the dots from 1 to 12 to reveal a fish swimming in the forest stream!

pages.title: Forest Friends Find Their Way Home
pages.instruction: Help the little woodland friends hop through the path to get home!

pages.title: Forest Friends Find Their Way Home
pages.instruction: Help the woodland animals find their way through the forest!

pages.title: Forest Friends' Path Home
pages.instruction: Help the forest friends find their way home!

pages.title: Forest Friends Find Their Home
pages.instruction: Help the little forest friend find their way home!

pages.title: Match the Forest Friends!
pages.instruction: Draw lines to connect the matching forest friends.

pages.title: Match the Pairs!
pages.instruction: Draw lines to connect each forest friend with its matching friend!

pages.title: Match the Forest Friends!
pages.instruction: Draw lines to connect the matching forest friends.

pages.title: Match the Forest Friends!
pages.instruction: Draw lines to connect the matching forest friends!

pages.title: Count the Balloons
pages.instruction: Count all the balloons the forest friends are holding and write the number!

pages.title: Count the Fishs
pages.instruction: Count how many fishs are swimming and write the number!

pages.title: Count the Circles
pages.instruction: Count all the circles and write the number 7!

pages.title: Count the Hearts
pages.instruction: Count all the hearts the forest friends are holding and write the number!

- Target age: 4–5 years old

- Lots of white space; minimal clutter
- Friendly 1-sentence instructions
- Difficulty: easy
- No copyrighted characters or brands
- Keep the theme consistent across pages: 'forest-friends'
Create specifications for a simple coloring page for a 4–5 year old child.
Theme: forest-friends
Page Number: 1

CRITICAL REQUIREMENT: You MUST use THIS EXACT subject: "rabbit"
Available options were: fox, bear, owl, rabbit, hedgehog, deer, squirrel, raccoon, snail, mushroom, acorn, pine tree
Already used (DO NOT REPEAT): none yet

You must use EXACTLY: "rabbit"

Return ONLY valid JSON (no markdown, no code blocks):

  "title": "Color the Rabbit",
  "instruction": "Use your crayons to color me in!",
  "subject": "rabbit",
  "description": "[2-3 word fun description of the rabbit]",
  "theme": "forest-friends"
}
claude_logs.response:
```json

  "instruction": "Use your crayons to color me in!",

}
```
